modules.description: This module provides types and modules required to connect to databases using Lwt, including connection handling, error conversion via `or_fail`, and support for streaming and switchable operations. It works with Lwt-based asynchronous I/O, connection pools, and database query streams. Concrete use cases include managing database connections in Unix or MirageOS environments and composing asynchronous database operations with Lwt.

This module manages a pool of database connections on Unix-like platforms using Lwt, allowing controlled resource allocation and reuse. It provides operations to check the current pool size, execute functions with a pooled resource, and drain all open resources. Concrete use cases include limiting concurrent database access in web applications and ensuring proper resource cleanup during service shutdown.

This module provides functions for establishing and managing database connections on Unix-like platforms using Lwt. It includes operations for connecting to a database via a URI, executing code with a managed connection, and creating connection pools with configurable limits and post-connect hooks. The module works directly with Lwt-based result types, connection modules, and switch constructs, enabling non-blocking, concurrent database access in applications like web servers and background services.
